intro: Psychotria hylocharis, commonly known as the black psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Psychotria hylocharis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
